title: What is the current state of Rust? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s stable enough for development your new application.With a nice dependence manager(`cargo`).Searching at the Github/Google, you could get many Rust library(90% of them are good examples).Something in the Rust standard library is Unstable.You need much more learning time to be a real Rust programmer, when compared with javaScript, C or Golang.

Fairly nice. It’s missing An ABIA standardSupport for several architecturesbut overall it’s a nice competitor to C++ and often C. The compiler is in better shape than it once was (it produces fast code). Cargo, the build tool which seems to be universally used, is pretty broken in a lot of ways but given that it’s competing with C++ that might be fine.
